1.4.1.3.1.1.1.2.1.1. ngeoFE_unittests.Multiphysics.Cauchy_tests.ThreeD.BVP package¶

1.4.1.3.1.1.1.2.1.1.1. Submodules¶

1.4.1.3.1.1.1.2.1.1.2. ngeoFE_unittests.Multiphysics.Cauchy_tests.ThreeD.BVP.CAUCHY_DP_HM_Hydroelasticity_0 module¶

Created on Jul 29, 2019

@author: Alexandros STATHAS

BVP Hydroelasticity, sets initial conditions and pressure at the bottom of an insulated 3D cantilever.

class ngeoFE_unittests.Multiphysics.Cauchy_tests.ThreeD.BVP.CAUCHY_DP_HM_Hydroelasticity_0.THM3D_FEformulation[source]¶

Bases: FEformulation

Defines a user FE formulation

auxiliary_fields(v)[source]¶

Set user’s generalized deformation vector

create_element(cell)[source]¶

Set desired element

dotv_coeffs()[source]¶

Set left hand side derivative coefficients

generalized_epsilon(v)[source]¶

Set user’s generalized deformation vector

setVarFormAdditionalTerms_Jac(u, Du, v, svars, metadata, dt, ddsdde)[source]¶

Set user’s additional terms at variational form for Jacobian

Parameters:

  • u (TrialFunction) – trial function

  • Du (Function) – increment of trial function

  • v (svars2) – test of test function

  • svars – function of state variables

  • dt (double) – time increment

  • dt – time increment

WARNING: the derivatives for calculating the Jacobian are made with the Trial function u and not with the Function Du.

setVarFormAdditionalTerms_Res(u, Du, v, svars, metadata, dt)[source]¶

Set user’s additional terms at variational form for Residual

Parameters:

  • u (TrialFunction) – trial function

  • Du (Function) – increment of trial function

  • v (svars2) – test of test function

  • svars – function of state variables

  • dt (double) – time increment

1.4.1.3.1.1.1.2.1.1.3. ngeoFE_unittests.Multiphysics.Cauchy_tests.ThreeD.BVP.CAUCHY_DP_HM_Hydroplasticity_0 module¶

Created on Jul 29, 2019

@author: Alexandros STATHAS BVP HydroPlasticity with a Cauchy continuum and a Drucker-Prager yield criterion, sets initial conditions and performs a 3D isochoric triaxial test in elasto-plasticity.

class ngeoFE_unittests.Multiphysics.Cauchy_tests.ThreeD.BVP.CAUCHY_DP_HM_Hydroplasticity_0.THM3D_FEformulation[source]¶

Bases: FEformulation

Set left hand side derivative coefficients

generalized_epsilon(v)[source]¶

Set user’s generalized deformation vector

setVarFormAdditionalTerms_Jac(u, Du, v, svars, metadata, dt, ddsdde)[source]¶

Set user’s additional terms at variational form for Jacobian

Parameters:

  • u (TrialFunction) – trial function

  • Du (Function) – increment of trial function

  • v (svars2) – test of test function

  • svars – function of state variables

  • dt (double) – time increment

  • dt – time increment

WARNING: the derivatives for calculating the Jacobian are made with the Trial function u and not with the Function Du.

setVarFormAdditionalTerms_Res(u, Du, v, svars, metadata, dt)[source]¶

Set user’s additional terms at variational form for Residual

Parameters:

  • u (TrialFunction) – trial function

  • Du (Function) – increment of trial function

  • v (svars2) – test of test function

  • svars – function of state variables

  • dt (double) – time increment

1.4.1.3.1.1.1.2.1.1.4. ngeoFE_unittests.Multiphysics.Cauchy_tests.ThreeD.BVP.CAUCHY_DP_HM_Hydroplasticity_1 module¶

Created on Jul 29, 2019

@author: Alexandros STATHAS BVP HydroPlasticity with a Cauchy continuum and a Drucker-Prager yield criterion, sets initial conditions and performs a 3D triaxial test in elasto-plasticity. The specimen lies under 1D compression, with negative dispacement at the top boundary.

class ngeoFE_unittests.Multiphysics.Cauchy_tests.ThreeD.BVP.CAUCHY_DP_HM_Hydroplasticity_1.THM3D_FEformulation[source]¶

  • u (TrialFunction) – trial function

  • Du (Function) – increment of trial function

  • v (svars2) – test of test function

1.4.1.3.1.1.1.2.1.1.7. ngeoFE_unittests.Multiphysics.Cauchy_tests.ThreeD.BVP.CAUCHY_THM_ThermoHydroplasticity_0 module¶

Created on Jul 29, 2019

@author: Alexandros STATHAS BVP Thermo-Hydro-plasticity with a Cauchy continuum and a Von-Mises yield criterion. It performs a 3D shear test in elasto-plasticity. The specimen lies under 1D shear, under adiabatic - undrained conditions.

class ngeoFE_unittests.Multiphysics.Cauchy_tests.ThreeD.BVP.CAUCHY_THM_ThermoHydroplasticity_0.THM3D_FEformulation[source]¶

Created on Jul 29, 2019

@author: Alexandros STATHAS BVP Thermo-elasticity with a Cauchy continuum. Applies temperature increase at the bootom of an insulated cantilever.

1.4.1.3.1.1.1.2.1.1.9. ngeoFE_unittests.Multiphysics.Cauchy_tests.ThreeD.BVP.CAUCHY_TM_Thermoplasticity_0 module¶

Created on Jul 29, 2019

@author: Alexandros STATHAS BVP Thermo-Plasticity with a Cauchy continuum and a Von-Mises yield criterion. It performs a 3D shear test in elasto-plasticity. The specimen lies under 1D shear, with adiabatic undrained boundary conditions

class ngeoFE_unittests.Multiphysics.Cauchy_tests.ThreeD.BVP.CAUCHY_TM_Thermoplasticity_0.THM3D_FEformulation[source]¶

Bases: FEformulation

Defines a user FE formulation

Set user’s generalized deformation vector

create_element(cell)[source]¶

Set desired element

dotv_coeffs()[source]¶

Set left hand side derivative coefficients

generalized_epsilon(v)[source]¶

Set user’s generalized deformation vector

setVarFormAdditionalTerms_Jac(u, Du, v, svars, metadata, dt, ddsdde)[source]¶

Set user’s additional terms at variational form for Jacobian

Parameters:

  • u (TrialFunction) – trial function

  • Du (Function) – increment of trial function

  • v (svars2) – test of test function

  • svars – function of state variables

  • dt (double) – time increment

  • dt – time increment

WARNING: the derivatives for calculating the Jacobian are made with the Trial function u and not with the Function Du.

setVarFormAdditionalTerms_Res(u, Du, v, svars, metadata, dt)[source]¶

Set user’s additional terms at variational form for Residual

Parameters:

  • u (TrialFunction) – trial function

  • Du (Function) – increment of trial function

  • v (svars2) – test of test function

  • svars – function of state variables

  • dt (double) – time increment
